> [atomiserxenolith](#comment_15_1CFQMjPvz8m5BHtMnGyE7tRktdQ69WwUSX): Don't 'destroy', undermine with counter - economics [...]

I agree, make ZeroNet more and more easy to use, to the point it makes as much a buzz as Tor, Make sure the powers that are ruining the clearnet dont get their hands on it and grow. Clearnet is already full of clutter, the only good content is 1% compared to the 99% that is absolute garbage degenerate crap. The few of us that are smart enough to create a welcoming community that promotes better internet etiquette should do just that. It will be hard, and maybe not everyone will be on board, but i don't think that fighting against censorship is worth it, especially on a platform where your voice can be silenced by smear campaigns and being denied advertiser revenue. I may not make sense because it's late, but we can probably do it. 
I've only had zeronet for a few minutes and it's so much better than the alternatives. Its installed quickly and works straight out of the box. When we have a dedicated browser it's gonna be even better.
